nodes.text: The wall phone list is laminated, updated, and slightly curled at the corners (pause) like it’s been worried by too many careful hands. (pause) “OLEA — LEGAL (Work Orders / Waivers)” is circled in fading pen.

choices.text: use: Call OLEA Legal.
leave: Don’t call.

nodes.text: The handset is heavier than it needs to be. (pause) The dial tone arrives with the patience of something that expects to be blamed later.
After three rings, someone answers without saying hello.
Office of Legacy Energy Assets, Legal. (pause) Recorded line. (pause) Name and assignment.
“Closure activities.” (pause) Okay. (pause) I’ll get the paper moving. (pause) I’m not signing anything that looks like fieldwork. (pause) And don’t say “authorize” on my line.

choices.text: talk: I need authorization to enter and proceed.
ask: I need a Work Order.
ask: What can you put in writing?
leave: Hang up.

nodes.text: I can’t give you “authorization to enter.” (pause) That makes it sound like we checked conditions. (pause) We haven’t. (pause) What I can sign is a Work Order— (pause) tight scope: one asset and closure documentation. (pause) That’s what I’m allowed to sign.

choices.text: ask: Then issue the Work Order.
ask: So what am I allowed to say I’m doing?
talk: I’m standing at the site. I need coverage.
ask: Back up. Start over.
leave: End call.

nodes.text:
Say you’re “on site for closure documentation.” (pause)
Keep “investigating” out. (pause)
Same with “evaluating anomalous conditions.” (pause)
Same with “confirming safety.” (pause)
Don’t put those words in your mouth. (pause)
Stick to the checklist. (pause)
Funding deadline’s on us. (pause)
That’s it.

choices.text: ask: Then issue the Work Order.
ask: Back to the main question.
leave: End call.

nodes.text: I can cover one narrow task (pause) on one specific asset. (pause) I’m not giving you a blanket line. (pause) It can't read like we saw it coming. (pause) You want coverage— (pause) keep it boring. (pause) Keep it specific.

A Work Order. (pause) A waiver. (pause) A memo: the call happened. (pause) I’m not writing anything (pause) that says we predicted outcomes or endorsed conditions (pause) or “authorized entry.” (pause) That turns a building into a promise.

choices.text: ask: I need a Work Order.
talk: Fine. Authorization isn’t the word.
leave: End call.

nodes.text: Alright. Work Order I can do. (pause) It has to hang off an asset. (pause) Give me the asset ID.

I can—once I have the asset identifier. (pause) The one in the register. (pause) Save me the nickname, the acronym. (pause) People freestyle this part. (pause) Then we spend six months (pause) calling it a “clerical error.”

choices.text: give: Asset ID is SP-01.
talk: I don’t have the asset ID in front of me.
look: What does the register call it?
persuade: Issue it provisionally; I’ll confirm the ID after.
ask: Back to the main menu.
leave: End call.

SP-zero-one. Good. (pause)
I’m issuing the Work Order now. (pause)
Closure-support only—verification and documentation. (pause)
Standard retirement checklist. (pause)
No deviation. (pause)
Don’t write anything that sounds like “testing.” (pause)
I’ll fax it to the facility’s posted number.

choices.text: ask: Give me the reference number.
talk: No. Just send it.

nodes.text: Reference number’s WO-RET-SP01. (pause) Write that. (pause) Leave “authorized” out. (pause) Write: “Work Order issued for SP-01 closure documentation.”

I’m sending it. (pause)
Don’t call it “authorization.” (pause)
Call it: “Work Order issued for SP-01 (pause) closure documentation.” (pause)
Bye.

Then I can’t issue anything. (pause)
Wrong asset on the Work Order (pause)
turns “coverage” into a discrepancy. (pause)
And discrepancies grow legs. (pause)
Find the plaque. (pause)
Find the posted register. (pause)
Find the asset tag. (pause)
Whatever passes for ID out there. (pause)
Call me back.

I’m not your registry service. (pause)

I’m not buying a later fight over knowledge— (pause)
or when. (pause)
You’re onsite. Use the onsite label. (pause)

nowhere to file it. (pause)

Bring me the asset ID. (pause)
I’ll issue the actual instrument.

No. (pause) I can give you wording. (pause) I can’t issue instruments (pause) without an identifier. (pause) Call back with the ID. (pause) The system only behaves with specifics. (pause) Rush jobs get ugly.
